title: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in RDoc wiki pages

profile.name: GitLab
profile.about: A single application for the entire software development lifecycle.

vulnerability_information:
### Summary When creating an RDoc wiki page it's possible to use a large number of html tags and attributes that are normally sanitized, when creating a linkable image of the format `{}[link]` For example it is possible to specify a `class` attribute when creating an image link: ```rdoc { }[a] ``` will generate the following: ```html

Full Page link

``` This will place a link taking over the entire page and intercept any clicks, `atwho-view select2-drop-mask pika-select` are just some real classes that make the links position absolute with a high z-index. The `target` attribute could also be set to `_blank` and as there is no `rel="noopener"` [reverse tabnabbing](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Reverse_Tabnabbing) is also possible. Another attack that is more likely to work would be to create a form in a modal, which could be used to ask for a username and password: ```rdoc a form {

Please Log In

}[/] ``` Which produces the following dialog when viewing the page: {F541421} ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a wiki on gitlab 1. Add a new RDoc page with the above snippet 1. Save and wait for someone to click it ### Impact An attacker could trick a user into thinking they had clicked on a gitlab element when they are actually redirected to the attackers site, or be presented with a dialog that will post to an attackers site. ### Examples Example linking to a fake sign in form: https://gitlab.com/wbowling/wiki/wikis/home Example creating a modal form: https://gitlab.com/wbowling/wiki/wikis/home2 ### What is the current *bug* behavior? When using an image link in RDoc the anchor tag attributes are not sanitized correctly. ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? They should be correctly sanitized. ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com #### Results of GitLab environment info ``` System information System: Ubuntu 16.04 Current User: git Using RVM: no Ruby Version: 2.6.3p62 Gem Version: 2.7.9 Bundler Version:1.17.3 Rake Version: 12.3.2 Redis Version: 3.2.12 Git Version: 2.21.0 Sidekiq Version:5.2.7 Go Version: unknown GitLab information Version: 12.1.1 Revision: f9abaa7d833 Directory: /opt/gitlab/embedded/service/gitlab-rails DB Adapter: PostgreSQL DB Version: 10.7 URL: http://gitlab-vm.local HTTP Clone URL: http://gitlab-vm.local/some-group/some-project.git SSH Clone URL: git@gitlab-vm.local:some-group/some-project.git Using LDAP: no Using Omniauth: yes Omniauth Providers: GitLab Shell Version: 9.3.0 Repository storage paths: - default: /var/opt/gitlab/git-data/repositories GitLab Shell path: /opt/gitlab/embedded/service/gitlab-shell Git: /opt/gitlab/embedded/bin/git ``` ## Impact Trick users into giving up their account details via a legitimate looking form on gitlab.com

activities.message:
Hi @vakzz,

Thank you for submitting this report. We will investigate the issue as soon as possible.
Due to our current workload, we will get back within 14 business days with an update.

Please refrain from submitting your report or inquiring about its status through
additional channels, as this unnecessarily binds resources in the security team.

Best regards,
GitLab Security Team

Due to the XSS I've changed the above project to be private, let me know if you require access and I can add anyone as a member or provide and export.

Cheers,
Will

Hello @vakzz ,

Thank you for submitting this report.

We have verified this finding and have escalated to our engineering team.  We will be tracking progress internally at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/65335.  This issue will be made public 30 days following the release of a patch.

We will continue to update you via HackerOne as a patch is scheduled for release.

Best regards,
Costel
Security Team | GitLab Inc.

Hi @gitlab_cmaxim,

Thanks for the quick response and update, let me know if you require any other information otherwise I will wait for the next release or patch and retest.

Would you be able to change this report from clickjacking to stored cross site scripting? I am unable to edit that section of the report.

Cheers,
Will

ETA for fix:

Hi @vakzz,

The GitLab issue created from your report is currently scheduled for 2019-10-22.

Thank you again for contacting us!

Best regards,
GitLab Security Team

additional_data.old_title: Incorrect image link sanitization in RDoc wiki pages
additional_data.new_title: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in RDoc wiki pages

activities.message:
Hi @vakzz, 

I have updated the title and severity. We will let you know when a fix was deployed.

Best Regards,
Costel
Security Team | GitLab Inc.

Thanks for that @gitlab_cmaxim, once the new release is out or a fix is deployed I'll give it another test to confirm.

Cheers,
Will

Hi @vakzz,

Just wanted to give you an update regarding this issue: In the previous security release there were several fixes for the XSS related issues. 
You can find more details here: 
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/64033 -- to be public at the end of september.
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/60143 
 
With these patches the XSS part of this report does not reproduce and we consider it as a duplicate. The engineering team is working on fixing the initial issue reported (rel="noopener").

We will keep you posted once a fix is released.

Regards,
Costel

Hi @gitlab_cmaxim,

Thanks for the update. Has the security release been applied to https://gitlab.com or is it an upcoming release? I'm still seeing that the POC for the XSS is working, eg https://gitlab.com/wbowling/wiki/wikis/home3

Cheers,
Will

This may be fixed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/64033 if that is for an upcoming release (not sure until it's made public), but here are a few more details just in case. The vector only allows for safe elements and attributes to be added, but combining that with the script gadget in [gl_field_error.js](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/blob/master/app%2Fassets%2Fjavascripts%2Fgl_field_error.js#L66) allows it to be turned into an XSS (Similar to this talk https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-17/thursday/us-17-Lekies-Dont-Trust-The-DOM-Bypassing-XSS-Mitigations-Via-Script-Gadgets.pdf) The following HTML is generated by the POC posted above which is free from any XSS, but after [main.js#L329](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/main.js#L329) is run it will become and XSS. ```html

``` https://gitlab.com/wbowling/wiki/wikis/home3 Cheers, Will

Hi @gitlab_cmaxim,

Looking at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/64033 now that is is public, I think this is a different issue? The supplied [POC at home3](https://gitlab.com/wbowling/wiki/wikis/home3) is still working on the latest version, but being blocked on gitlab.com due to the new: CSP rules `Content Security Policy: The page's settings blocked the loading of a resource at inline ("script-src"). home3:25:34643`

Cheers,
Will

I've added a version at https://gitlab.com/wbowling/wiki/wikis/home3b that includes a CSP bypass, although it does require the user to click anywhere on the page. The final RDoc payload is: ```RDoc {
}[#] ``` This creates the following html which is inserted via jQuery, creating a full screen link overlaying everything: ```html

``` This will cause `jquery-ujs` to fire an ajax request when clicked to our url (hosted on gitlab so it's allowed under the `self` policy of `script-src`), and end up running through `jQuery.globalEval(text, { nonce: getCspNonceValue() });` in [main.js#L53](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/blob/master/app%2Fassets%2Fjavascripts%2Fmain.js#L53) executing the payload. {F606367}

Hi @vakzz,

Thank you for your updates and effort invested in this report, I have forwarded the information to our dev team. A fix is currently developed, I will let you know when it can be tested on gitlab.com.

Regards,
Costel 
GitLab Security Team

Hi @gitlab_cmaxim,

I see the fix for this went out in the latest release, can confirm that I can no longer reproduce the issue.

Cheers,
Will

Hello @vakzz,

Thank you again for the report and retesting this! Your finding has been patched in GitLab version 12.4.1 and we are awarding a bounty. Congratulations! Your report will be published in 30 days in GitLab's issue tracker.

We look forward to your next report!

Best regards,
Costel
Security Team | GitLab Inc.
